metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8674 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13, Safari 13. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross site scripting.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8674` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.24.4-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.24.4-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.24.4-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.24.4-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.24.4-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.24.4-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.24.4-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.24.4-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.24.4-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.24.4-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.24.4-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.24.4-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.24.4-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.24.4-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.24.4-1').
